oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Oliver Hazard Perry
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Engraving depicts Commodore Oliver Hazard Perry seated on ship's deck. Perry wears U.S. Navy uniform of dark jacket and white trousers. A pistol is tucked in his belt. A large flag emblazoned with the words, "DON'T GIVE UP THE SHIP," waves in the background. Facsimile signature.

Perry was a U.S. naval officer who became a national hero when he defeated a British squadron in the Battle of Lake Erie (September 10, 1813) during the War of 1812. The victory gave the Americans full control of the strategic lake. Perry's report to General William Henry Harrison stated simply, "We have met enemy and they are ours."
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: Chappel, Alonzo, 1828-1887
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: Perry, Oliver Hazard, 1785-1819
